SENT.plain: Therapeutic hypothermia (TH) is a process of cooling a patient post ventricular tachycardia/ventricular fibrillation (VT/VF) cardiac arrest to 32-34 degrees C for 24 hours
This improves neurological outcome and is part of current guidelines
Hypothermia prolongs QT interval, which can precipitate torsades de pointes (TdP)

We performed a retrospective review of all patients who received TH in our hospital over a period of 2 years to assess the effect of TH on the corrected OT interval (QTc) and any possible pro-arrhythmia
A total of 13 patients received TH
QTc prolonged in all patients with an average of 80.3 + 57.2 ms., and up to 109.8 + 80.4 ms in patients who received Amiodarone concurrently
No TdP was seen in any patient
We conclude that TH is safe, though careful monitoring of the OTc interval is advisable especially with concurrent use of QT prolonging drugs
